definition: A branch of mathematics in which symbols are used to represent numbers and quantities in formulas and equations.
examples: In algebra, letters stand for unknown numbers.
She solved an algebra equation in class.

extra.memory_tip: Algebra = maths with letters and unknowns.

definition: A deep valley with steep rocky sides, often with a river flowing through it.
examples: The Grand Canyon is famous for its size.
A narrow canyon cut through the desert.

extra.memory_tip: Canyon = giant rocky crack in the land.

definition: The quality of being brave and willing to take risks; adventurous or bold.
examples: The firefighter’s daring saved many lives. (noun)
She made a daring leap across the gap. (adjective)

extra.memory_tip: Daring = courage to do risky things.

definition: The thin fold of skin that covers and protects the eye.
examples: Her eyelids felt heavy with sleep.
Eyelids blink to keep eyes moist.

extra.memory_tip: Eyelid = skin curtain for your eye.

definition: An informal name for a violin; to play with something restlessly or to play the violin.
examples: He played a lively tune on his fiddle. (noun)
Stop fiddling with your pen. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Fiddle = small violin or restless fingers.

definition: A hard protective hat worn to protect the head.
examples: Cyclists must wear a helmet.
The soldier’s helmet was dented.

extra.memory_tip: Helmet = safety shell for your head.

definition: A field in which grass and wild flowers grow.
examples: Butterflies danced over the meadow.
Cows grazed in the green meadow.

extra.memory_tip: Meadow = grassy open field full of flowers.

definition: A small lump of valuable metal such as gold; a small, tasty piece of food.
examples: The prospector found a gold nugget.
She ate a chicken nugget.

extra.memory_tip: Nugget = little lump of goodness or value.

definition: A break between school lessons; a small hollow space; to set or be set back into something.
examples: Playtime begins at morning recess. (noun)
A statue was recessed into the wall. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Recess = time-out or little hollow spot.

definition: The loud rumbling sound following a lightning flash; to make a loud, deep noise.
examples: A clap of thunder shook the windows. (noun)
Horses thundered across the plain. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Thunder = sky drum roll or any deep rumble.
